page.title: 05The M3 Extension.
page.content: The M3 extension from Popham to Bar End was finished Spring 1985. Mott, Hay and Anderson hope to finish the Bar End to Bassett stretch in 1988. They designed the M3 extension because of the volume of traffic. The M3 has 3 sometimes 4 lanes. Popham to Bar End has 3 sometimes 2. The motorway was built by laying a base of pebbles 2m down, then sand or finer material, covered with layers of stone (for drainage), then a surface of asphalt or concrete. The next part,Bar End to Bassett will cost Â£50 million . Mott, Hay and Anderson are the consultant engineers. They had problems with purchasing the land, farmers and other people objecting to losing their land and the noise.The old Winchester By-Pass will be left.The Spitfire Bridge was knocked down because it was cheaper to replace it with a new one.
